meanings.definition: (adjective) having distinct layers, typically of sediment
meanings.sent1: The varved rocks showed clear layers of sand and clay.
meanings.sent2: The geologist studied the varved soil to understand its history.
meanings.sent3: The varved cake had alternating layers of chocolate and vanilla.
meanings.sent4: Her varved artwork combined different textures to create depth.
meanings.sent5: The varved bookshelf displayed a beautiful arrangement of books.

meanings.definition: (verb) to form distinct layers, as in sedimentation
meanings.sent1: Over time, the river varved the sediment into distinct layers.
meanings.sent2: The lake varved every year, creating a record of environmental changes.
meanings.sent3: I varved the sandcastle, making sure each layer was visible.
meanings.sent4: The artist varved the colors on the canvas to create a unique pattern.
meanings.sent5: The glacier varved the valley with its slow movement.
